context_of_use: This use case allows customers to track their order status and managers to review and approve orders within the system.
stakeholders_and_interests: customer: wants to track order status to stay informed about delivery.
manager: wants to approve orders to ensure timely processing and avoid delays.
description: Enables customers to track order status and managers to review and approve orders.
triggering_event: Customer requests to track an order or manager receives an order for approval.
preconditions: Manager has access to the order management system.
postconditions: Customer can view the current status of their order.
Manager has either approved or rejected the order, updating its status accordingly.
assumptions: Customers have accounts to track their orders.
Managers have the necessary permissions to approve orders.
requirements_met: The system shall allow customers to track their orders.
The system shall allow managers to approve orders.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the process for order approval and notification to customers.
main_flow: 1. Customer requests to track an order → System displays the current status of the order.
2. Manager reviews the order details → System presents order information for approval.
3. Manager approves the order → System updates the order status to approved and notifies the customer.
4. Manager rejects the order → System updates the order status to rejected and notifies the customer.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 1): If the customer enters an invalid order ID, the system displays an error message and prompts for a valid ID, returning to Step 1.
AF-2 (from Step 2): If the manager needs more information, they can request additional details before making a decision, returning to Step 2.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 1): If the system is down, the customer receives a notification that the order tracking service is unavailable and is advised to try again later.
EF-2 (from Step 2): If the order details cannot be retrieved, the system informs the manager of the error and suggests checking the order ID.
